alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 7:23PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Concordia and central Catahoula Parishes through 800 PM CDT... At 723 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Frogmore, or 8 miles northwest of Ferriday, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wildsville and Wallace Ridge around 730 PM CDT. Jonesville around 735 PM CDT. Archie and Manifest around 740 PM CDT. Walters around 745 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
